page.title: 06ANCIENT AYLESFORD
page.content: Tourist attractions include the Neolithic long barrow known as Kits Coty House,one of the best known Neolilthic monuments in the U.K.The structure consists of four sarsens, three are upright, supporting a large flat capstore.Legend informs us that is was formerly the home of a shepherd named Christopher who lived in whichever side was sheltered from inclement weather - a possible orgin for the name.Little Kits Coty, or The Countless Stones was similar to Kits Coty House but is completely ruined.This stone age burial chamber is visited by many who try to count the jumbled stones.Cage Hill,Aylesford was the site of a cavity in the wall covered by an iron grill in which offenders were held overnight.The cage no longer exsists but the site is marked by a plaque.
